options.content:
# Welcome to Grafana 8.0

Grafana v8.0 adds many visualizations and improvements to panel edit, tracing and security. This dashboard highlights 
some of the new visualization capabilities. There are so many new visualizations and display options so be sure to scroll down
to see everything. 

[Read the what's new article](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana/next/whatsnew/whats-new-in-v8-0/)   |  
[Download](https://grafana.com/grafana/download/beta)   |  
[Grafana Cloud now free with 50gb logs, 10K metric series](https://grafana.com/signup/cloud/connect-account?pg=play&plcmt=whatnew)

## State timeline

The new state timeline panel is one of the new core visualizations. 
It adds unique state over time visualization for string or boolean states. 

### Map strings to colors

With the new revamped value mapping feature you 
can now easily map strings, booleans, nulls & NaN values
to a color or new display text. 

This mapping and coloring support will work in all new core panels.

### Discrete time series

It can also transform any numerical time series into discrete states trough 
thresholds. This allow you to quickly gauge health over time and visualize
the duration spent in each threshold bracket.

panels.title: State timeline with time series + thresholds

options.content:
## Status history

A sister panel to the state timeline is the new Status history panel. It can visualize periodic state in a 
grid. Works with both numerical, string or boolean state.

panels.title: State timeline with time series + thresholds

options.content:
## Bar chart 

A new bar chart panel adds new graphing capabilities to Grafana, especially for non
time series based data. It supports a categorical x or y field, grouped bars, horizontal 
and vertical layout.

## Next-gen Graph

The new next-gen graphing visualization named `Time series` is now the default
visualization in v8. It supports many new options as well as improved performance.
Below we highlight some new features.

### Interpolation modes

The new time series panel brings a new interpolation mode
where you can choose between.
* Linear
* Smooth
* Step before
* Step after (same as old staircase option)

### Soft min and max

Auto **Min** and **Max** can make small variations look much bigger than they  are. This can be fixed by setting **Min** & **Max**. 
This creates a new problem when spikes in the data occur. Because the 
**Min** and **Max** are hard the full spike cannot be seen. The **Soft min** and **Soft max** options give control over the default range of the axis but also allow going beyond this range when the data does. 

You can combine both the existing standard option **Min** and **Max** and the new **Soft min**
 and **Soft max** to define both soft and hard limits.

### Multiple Y-Axes

With the new panel you can have more than 2 y-axes!

### Richer display options

The new time series panel supports more control over lines, fill gradients that 
work for both line, area graphs & bars.

## Histogram

This hidden feature of the old Graph panel is now a standalone visualization. It combines a histogram 
transformation and bar chart visualization into single integrated easy to use panel. There is also a new standalone histogram 
transformation that can be paired with any visualization.
